details.title: Aircraft antenna coupling minimization using genetic algorithms and approximations
details.abstract: Genetic algorithms (GAs) are used to minimize antenna coupling by optimally positioning multiple radiators. Initial GA parameters are selected using a simple cylindrical model, and the results are used to optimize antenna placement on a realistic aircraft surface model. A novel aggregate objective function incorporating surface wave coupling, variance of the coupling values, and radiation pattern analysis is used. Multiple computational and experimental data are shown to validate the methodology.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
